procedure.title: Sending MARK messages
procedure.para: If there are no new messages that have to be sent to the destination server, the &agent; application automatically sends a MARK message every ten minutes to notify the server that the connection is still active. The exact format of the MARK message depends on the protocol:
To change how often the &agentabbrev; sends these messages, complete the following steps.

step.para: Start the configuration interface of the &agent; application.
Select syslog-ng Agent Settings and double-click on Global Settings.
Select Enable, then select Mark Mode Options.
Set the frequency of MARK messages that the &agent; application sends.

listitem.para: Never: Do not send MARK messages.
When destination idle: Send MARK messages only if there were no other messages sent to the destination during the specified period.
Periodically: Send MARK messages every time the specified period expires.

step.para: Set the time between two MARK messages in the The number of seconds between two MARK messages. By default, this is 600 seconds (10 minutes).
Select Apply, then OK. To activate the changes, restart the &agentabbrev; service.
